current_headlines.headline: President of Somalia: Israel has reached an agreement with Somaliland on three axes! Hassan Sheikh Mahmoud, President of Somalia, announced: There are three important informational topics that must be stated, Israel has reached an agreement with Somaliland on three axes; transfer of Palestinians to Somalia, establishment of a base in Somaliland, and signing of the Abraham Accords by Somaliland. These three axes are the points of agreement between Israel and the separatist group Somaliland. The President of Somalia added: The question arises as to why Israel should have a base in Somalia. There is no place for Israel to defend itself in Somalia, and what is observed is that Israel is preparing or positioning itself to attack another location.
current_headlines.keywords: Israel, Somalia, Somaliland, base, agreement, Palestinians, Abraham Accords, attack, preparing, positioning

current_headlines.headline: Claim by Euronews: $2.5 billion from Russia transferred to Iran secretly According to documents received by The Telegraph newspaper, a Russian state bank, shortly after the US withdrawal from the JCPOA by Trump's order and the reimposition of US sanctions against Iran, began secretly transferring $2.5 billion in cash in 34 shipments to Iran.
current_headlines.keywords: Russia, Iran, $2.5 billion, secret transfer, JCPOA, sanctions, shipments, bank

history_headlines.headline: The Regavim movement in response to the Cabinet decisions: "The Israeli government has decided, the Oslo concept to the trash" "A struggle of many years, hundreds of discussions, field tours and in-depth studies led to the series of dramatic decisions that were made a short while ago in the security cabinet. Israeli governments throughout the generations hesitated, ignored and abandoned, and into the vacuum entered the murderous Palestinian Authority and worked to establish a terrorist state in the heart of the country. The decisions cancel a distorted reality of racism and discrimination against Jews regarding lands in Judea and Samaria: exposing the land registry that was confidential, canceling the Jordanian law that prohibits the sale of lands to Jews, enforcement against damage to heritage sites and environmental damage in Areas A and B, all these indicate: Zionism is not measured by declarations and talk, but by actions. We congratulate the members of the cabinet on the historic decision led by Defense Minister Katz and Finance Minister Smotrich and commit to continue acting and promoting a Zionist land policy throughout the entire country."
history_headlines.keywords: Regavim, Cabinet, decisions, Oslo, security cabinet, Palestinian Authority, Judea, Samaria, lands, heritage, Katz, Smotrich, Zionist, policy

history_headlines.headline: Pushed by Minister Smotrich: The political-security cabinet today approved a series of dramatic decisions that will significantly impact the settlement situation in Judea and Samaria • Regarding land management: Until now, contrary to practice within the Green Line, the land registry in Judea and Samaria was confidential - which made land acquisition difficult and allowed fraud. Now, the cabinet has ordered the removal of confidentiality and the publication of the land registry, a step that will increase transparency and facilitate land redemption. • The cabinet canceled the Jordanian law that prohibits the sale of real estate to Jews. Until now, Jews were forced to purchase lands only through registered companies and subject to a cumbersome "transaction permit" from the Civil Administration. From now on, the requirement for a transaction permit has been canceled and the prohibition on sale to foreigners has been canceled, which will allow Jews to purchase land in Judea and Samaria exactly as they purchase in Tel Aviv or Jerusalem. Alongside this, the requirement for a transaction license from the Land Registration Officer has been canceled, and in its place only professional threshold conditions will be set, which will lead to the removal of a significant barrier in the local real estate market. • After years of foot-dragging by the Palestinian municipality of Hebron, it was decided to transfer the building licensing authorities in the Jewish settlement, the Cave of the Patriarchs and the additional holy sites in the city, from the municipality directly to the planning institutions of the Civil Administration. The meaning is that there will no longer be a need for a specific "withdrawal of authorities" every time they want to make the cave accessible or build in the city for Jews, and the planning procedures will become efficient and independent. Concurrently, it was decided to grant full municipal authorities to the Hebron administration, which will now be able to directly handle the needs of the settlers and prevent hazards, without dependence on the Palestinian mechanisms that until now required a complex and frustrating procedure. • Concurrently, the state is increasing its efforts in the war for heritage and environmental areas: it was decided to expand supervision and enforcement activities also to Areas A and B regarding water offenses, damage to archaeological sites and environmental hazards that pollute the entire area.
history_headlines.keywords: Smotrich, cabinet, decisions, settlement, Judea, Samaria, land, registry, Jews, transaction, Hebron, Civil Administration, heritage, enforcement, Areas A and B

history_headlines.headline: Member of the Political Council of Hezbollah of Lebanon: If a war is launched against Iran, oil exports in the Persian Gulf will be disrupted. Qamati: Iran insisted on its position and determined the location and agenda of the negotiations itself, and as a result, Netanyahu failed and became frustrated. Iran limited the negotiations solely to the nuclear case; Iran is a powerful country with independent sovereignty and defends itself. If a war is launched against Iran, Iran will stand firm and as a result, global trade will be damaged and the export and flow of oil in the Persian Gulf will be disrupted. Cyber Army of the Guardians @SEPAH
history_headlines.keywords: war, Iran, Persian Gulf, oil exports, disrupted, negotiations, nuclear, stand firm, global trade

history_headlines.headline: How the ghostly shadow of communism controls our world (A special NTD television series translated into Hebrew) Many people believe that communism disappeared with the end of the Cold War and the disintegration of the communist bloc in Eastern Europe. However, the truth is that communist ideology has only cunningly changed its form and continued to spread throughout the world. China, North Korea, Vietnam, and Cuba declare themselves communist. Former Soviet Union countries are still heavily influenced by communist ideology and practices, and countries in North America and Europe are welcoming communist influences with open arms without many people even realizing it. Over 100 years, communism has established massive dictatorships, caused more than 100 million deaths, enslaved billions of people, and brought the world to the brink of nuclear war and near destruction. However, the invisible damage is even worse, because communism has declared war on humanity itself - including the most basic human values and human dignity. This special television series reviews the true nature of communism and its secret goal. [To watch in Hebrew click here]( [For the series in English]( [For the series in Arabic]( [For the series in Russian]( •To join the NTD Hebrew channel on Telegram click here:
history_headlines.keywords: communism, shadow, world, ideology, spread, dictatorships, deaths, enslaved, nuclear war, destruction, humanity, values, dignity

history_headlines.headline: According to the advisor to General Mohsen Rezai, Tel Aviv's threats were not implemented, and Iran did not accept any of the signals transmitted to it. Over the past two weeks, two important messages were transmitted to Iran, and both were rejected. The first message came from the US. Washington made it clear that it intends to carry out a limited strike and expected Tehran to either 'swallow' it or not respond at all. Iran categorically refused, stating that it is revising the rules of war and red lines and will consider any strike as an act of full-scale war. The second message was sent by Israel through intermediaries. It claimed that Israel allegedly would not participate in the US attack, and Iran was asked not to strike Israel. This request also received a negative response. Tehran clearly stated: in case of the start of a US military operation, Israel will become a legitimate target. It is in this context that Netanyahu's latest threats sound. In parallel, Iran sent warnings to all countries in the region - from Baku to Riyadh, stating that any attack from their territory or through their airspace will be considered as an attack by these countries. According to the source, this was the main reason for the cancellation of the planned US strike last Tuesday night. The operation was postponed, and large-scale offensive and defensive forces were transferred to the region. These steps pursue three goals: deterrence, blocking a possible Iranian response, and preparation for an escalation scenario.
history_headlines.keywords: Iran, threats, messages, US, limited, strike, refused, full-scale, war, Israel, legitimate, target, warnings, countries, region, attack, territory, airspace, operation, postponed, forces
